data.name: Shared Words
data.description:
Find the shared words between 2 pieces of text.

Write a function called sharedWords that takes 2 strings and returns an array of the words that are shared between them.

A few things to note:

- The shared words should be returned in alphabetical order.
- The shared words should be returned in all lower case.
- Each shared word should only appear once in the returned array.
- The only puntuation that should appear within the shared words are hyphens ( - ) and apostophes ( ' ).
- Words with hyphens or apostrophes are considered different words to similar words without those punctuation marks. E.g., coders, coder's and coders' would all be considered different words and e-mail and email would be considered different words.
- Words that are abbreviated with a full stop should be compared and returned without the full stop. If one string contained "Dr." and the other contained "Dr" then "dr" should be returned as a shared word.
- Shared words should be words and not numbers. "1" should be ignored but "one" shouldn't be.
- There won't be any double punctuation like "What?!" or "HELP!!!".

Got all that? Good! Have fun!
